original_question: An action potential that starts at the axon hillock moves along the axon only toward what?

pred_ans_conf_OE: An action potential that starts at the axon hillock moves along the axon only toward the terminal buttons.
pred_diverse_ans: The action potential moves along the axon in a distal-to-proximal direction.
The action potential typically moves along the axon toward the axon terminals.
The action potential typically heads towards the axon terminals.

The action potential would end up at the termination zone of the axon.
The target destination of an action potential that starts at the axon hillock and progresses along the axon is the synapse.
The action potential moves down the length of the axon.
